==Events==
* [[313]] &ndash; The [[Edict of Milan]], signed by [[Constantine the Great]] and co-emperor [[Licinius|Valerius Licinius]] granting [[religious freedom]] throughout the [[Roman Empire]], is posted in [[Nicomedia]].
*[[1373]] &ndash; [[Anglo-Portuguese Alliance]] between [[Kingdom of England|England]] ([[Succession of states|succeeded]] by the [[United Kingdom]]) and [[Portugal]] is the oldest [[Military alliance|alliance]] in the world which is still in force. 
*[[1381]] &ndash; The [[Peasants Revolt]] led by [[Wat Tyler]] culminated in the burning of the [[Savoy Palace]].
*[[1525]] &ndash; [[Martin Luther]] marries [[Katharina von Bora]], against the [[celibacy]] rule decreed by the Roman Catholic Church for priests and nuns.
*[[1625]] &ndash; King [[Charles I of England]] marries [[Henrietta Maria of France]], [[Fils de France|Princess of France]]
*[[1740]] &ndash; [[Province of Georgia|Georgia]] provincial governor [[James Oglethorpe]] begins an unsuccessful attempt to take [[Spanish Florida]] during the [[Siege of St. Augustine (1740)|Siege of St. Augustine]].
*[[1774]] &ndash; [[Rhode Island]] becomes the first of Britain's North American colonies to ban the importation of slaves.
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Marquis de Lafayette]] lands near [[Charleston, South Carolina]], in order to help the [[Continental Congress]] to train its army.
*[[1805]] &ndash; [[Lewis and Clark Expedition]]: scouting ahead of the expedition, [[Meriwether Lewis]] and four companions sight the [[Great Falls of the Missouri River]].
*[[1881]] &ndash; The [[USS Jeannette (1878)|USS ''Jeannette'']] is crushed in an [[Arctic Ocean]] ice pack.
*[[1886]] &ndash; [[Great Vancouver Fire|A fire devastates]] much of [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]].
*1886   &ndash; [[King Ludwig II of Bavaria]] is found dead in [[Lake Starnberg]] south of [[Munich]] at 11:30 PM. 
*[[1893]] &ndash; [[Grover Cleveland]] notices a rough spot in his mouth and on July 1 undergoes [[Grover Cleveland#Cancer|secret, successful surgery]] to remove a large, cancerous portion of his jaw; the operation was not revealed to the public until 1917, nine years after the president's death.
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Yukon|Yukon Territory]] is formed, with [[Dawson, Yukon|Dawson]] chosen as its capital.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[University of the Philippines College of Engineering]] is established. This unit of the university is said to be the largest degree granting unit in the [[Philippines]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The deadliest German air raid on [[London]] during World War I is carried out by [[Gotha G]] bombers and results in 162 deaths, including 46 children, and 432 injuries. 
*[[1927]] &ndash; Aviator [[Charles Lindbergh]] receives a  [[ticker-tape parade]] down 5th Avenue in [[New York City]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: German combat elements - reinforced by the [[17th SS Panzergrenadier Division]] - [[Battle of Bloody Gulch|launch a counterattack]] on American forces near [[Carentan]].
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: [[Germany]] launches a [[V1 Flying Bomb]] attack on [[England]]. Only four of the eleven bombs actually hit their targets.
*[[1952]] &ndash; [[Catalina affair]]: A Swedish [[Douglas DC-3]] is shot down by a Soviet [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-15|MiG-15]] fighter.
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Mir Mine]], the first [[diamond]] mine in the [[Soviet Union|USSR]], is discovered.
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[United States Supreme Court]] rules in ''[[Miranda v. Arizona]]'' that the police must inform suspects of their rights before questioning them.
*[[1967]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] nominates Solicitor-General [[Thurgood Marshall]] to become the first black justice on the [[U.S. Supreme Court]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[List of Governors of Texas|Governor of Texas]] [[Preston Smith (governor)|Preston Smith]] signs a bill into law converting the former Southwest Center for Advanced Studies, originally founded as a research arm of [[Texas Instruments]], into the [[University of Texas at Dallas]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; "[[The Long and Winding Road]]" becomes [[The Beatles]]' last U.S. number one song.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: ''[[The New York Times]]'' begins publication of the [[Pentagon Papers]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; Convicted [[Martin Luther King Jr.]] assassin [[James Earl Ray]] is recaptured after escaping from [[prison]] three days before.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Israeli Defense Forces]] withdraw from [[Lebanon]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; At the [[Trooping the Colour]] ceremony in London, a teenager, [[Marcus Sarjeant]], fires six blank shots at Queen [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Elizabeth II]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Fahd of Saudi Arabia|Fahd]] becomes [[Kings of Saudi Arabia|King of Saudi Arabia]] upon the death of his brother, [[Khalid of Saudi Arabia|Khalid]].
*  1982   &ndash; [[Riccardo Paletti]], was killed when he crashed on the start grid for the [[Canadian Grand Prix]]
*[[1983]] &ndash; ''[[Pioneer 10]]'' becomes the first man-made object to leave the central [[Solar System]] when it passes beyond the orbit of [[Neptune]] (the furthest planet from the Sun at the time).
*[[1990]] &ndash; First day of the [[June 1990 Mineriad]] in Romania. At least 240 strikers and students are arrested or killed in the chaos ensuing from the first post-[[Ceausescu]] elections.
*[[1994]] &ndash; A jury in [[Anchorage, Alaska]], blames recklessness by [[Exxon]] and Captain [[Joseph Hazelwood]] for the ''[[Exxon Valdez]]'' disaster, allowing victims of the oil spill to seek $15 billion in damages.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[Montana Freemen]] surrender after an 81-day standoff with [[FBI]] agents.
*[[1997]] &ndash; A jury sentences [[Timothy McVeigh]] to [[Capital punishment|death]] for his part in the [[1995]] [[Oklahoma City bombing]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; President [[Kim Dae Jung]] of [[South Korea]] meets [[Kim Jong-il]], leader of [[North Korea]], for the beginning of the first ever inter-[[Korea]] summit, in the northern capital of [[Pyongyang]].
*  2000   &ndash; [[Italy]] pardons [[Mehmet Ali Agca]], the Turkish gunman who tried to kill Pope [[John Paul II]] in 1981.
*[[2002]] &ndash; The [[United States]] withdraws from the [[Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty]].
*  2002   &ndash; Two 14-year-old [[South Korean]] girls are [[Yangju highway incident|struck and killed]] by a [[United States Army]] [[armored vehicle]], leading to months of public protests against the U.S.
*[[2005]] &ndash; A jury in [[Santa Maria, California]] [[People v. Jackson|acquits]] pop singer [[Michael Jackson]] of molesting 13-year-old Gavin Arvizo at his [[Neverland Ranch]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; A capsule of the Japanese spacecraft [[Hayabusa (spacecraft)|Hayabusa]], containing particles of the asteroid [[25143 Itokawa]], returns to Earth.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[13 June 2012 Iraq attacks|series of bombings]] across [[Iraq]], including [[Baghdad]], [[Hillah]] and [[Kirkuk]], kills at least 93 people and wounds over 300 others.
